Detailed Description

template<class window>
struct egui::wnd< window >

Provides indirect access to on-the-screen window objects.

In case you have a wnd<> object, in order to access the C++ window object's functions, always use '->':

    wnd<> w = ...;
    w->some_method(...);
    bool shown = w->visible;
    w->enabled = false; // disable this window

wnd<> w = new_<form>(some_args); or wnd<form> w = new_(some_args);

Member Function Documentation

template<class window>
egui::wnd< window >::operator bool (  )  const [inline]

conversion to bool. If this is non-null, it returns the equivalent of true. Otherwise, it returns the equivalent of false.

You can use it in the if-assign idiom
